pr_title: HHH-10282 Short-hand enum syntax support for HQL

timeline.message: HHH-10282 Short-hand enum syntax support for HQL

timeline.bodyText:
We might consider the following pattern:
Stream.of( 
					context.getEntityTypesByEntityName().values().stream(),
					context.getMappedSuperclassTypeMap().values().stream(),
					context.getEmbeddableTypeSet().stream()
			).flatMap( Function.identity() ).forEach( ... )

As per https://www.techempower.com/blog/2016/10/19/efficient-multiple-stream-concatenation-in-java/, the flatmap approach performs better when the stream sizes are not large.
timeline.author: NathanQingyangXu

replies.bodyText: According to the article the suggestion is to use flatMap(Stream::concat) so I'd rather stick to this pattern.

timeline.bodyText:
I think it is one of @sebersole 's personal styles to leave out the blank line before the first element statement in a class. I prefer the above change but it is not a big deal.
Another style of Steve is to leave out the space delimiter between generic types as following:
Map<K,V> map; // I would prefer Map<K, V> map

But I don't think it is a big deal and they have become my style components as well, :).
